subject: Is this the right way?
msgSnippet: I am able to compile my Factorial.java, but can not run the test runner...am I even doing it the right way? Can someone help...Thanks wanni! import
messageBody:
I am able to compile my Factorial.java, but can not
run the test runner...am I even doing it the right
way? Can someone help...Thanks wanni!

import java.util.*;
import junit.framework.*;
import junit.framework.Test;
import junit.framework.TestCase;
import junit.framework.TestSuite;


public class Factorial extends TestCase {

public static void main(String[] args) {

int input = Integer.parseInt(args[0]);
double result = factorial(input);
System.out.println(result);
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());


}

public static Test suite() {


TestSuite suite = new
TestSuite(Factorial.class);


return suite;
}

public static double factorial(int x){
if (x<0)
return 0.0;
double fact = 1.0;
while (x>0) {
fact=fact*x;
x=x-1;
}
return fact;
}
}
